macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US500 Index Falls 0.80% to 6886 Points on January 19
items.summary: The US500 dropped 0.80% on January 19 amid weakness in cyclical sectors like industrials, materials, and financials, while Nasdaq Composite rose 0.16% boosted by Alphabet's 2.5% gain. JOLTS data indicated a sharp drop in job openings signaling cooling labor demand, ADP showed modest private hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations.[1]

items.title: US Stocks Close Mixed Amid Uneven Economic Data and Fed Easing Expectations
items.summary: S&P 500 eased 0.2% and Dow slid 0.8% from highs, while Nasdaq 100 gained 0.1% as investors weighed mixed data including declining JOLTS against hopes for Federal Reserve easing.[1]

items.title: Signs of US Stock Market Rotation: Small Caps Outpace Large Caps and Tech Slumps
items.summary: Small-cap stocks lead with 5.94% gains in value index and 6.02% in growth versus large caps at 2.80% and 0.13%; tech sector down 0.40% YTD after 2025 AI boom, amid macroeconomic strength and geopolitics.[3]

items.title: Major Indexes Post Weekly Losses as Treasury Yields Climb Amid Fed Speculation
items.summary: US markets face uncertainty in January 2026 with weekly losses for major indexes and Treasury yields at four-month highs, sparking speculation on Federal Reserve's next moves.[2]

items.title: Trump Threatens 25% Tariffs on France, UK, Sweden Over Greenland Military Exercises
items.summary: President Trump warned of up to 25% tariffs on several countries including France, UK, and Sweden if they proceed with military exercises in Greenland, likely impacting Monday market open.[5]

items.title: Busy Week Ahead: Key Central Bank Updates, US GDP, Core PCE, and Earnings
items.summary: Upcoming events include ECB's Lagarde and Trump at Davos, BoJ rate decision, US Core PCE and GDP on Thursday, plus flash PMIs and Canadian data; US markets closed Monday for MLK Day.[5]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils Vera Rubin AI Platform
items.summary: NVIDIA announced its new Vera Rubin AI platform in January 2026, integrating advanced GPU, CPU, DPU, and networking silicon to accelerate deep learning training and inference with higher performance and efficiency.

items.title: 2026 Corporate AI Outlook Study Released
items.summary: The AI Leaders Council released its 2026 Corporate AI Outlook Study on January 19, 2026, revealing AI adoption trends, with organizations prioritizing workforce productivity, operational efficiency, and investments in training and infrastructure; results to be previewed on January 20 webcast.

items.title: AAAI-26 Conference Spotlights Key AI Research
items.summary: AAAI-26 in Singapore (January 20-27, 2026) highlights research on data-centric AI for LLMs, Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA), and NORA-1.5 vision-language-action model for robotics, achieving state-of-the-art benchmarks.

items.title: MCML Announces 9 Papers at AAAI 2026
items.summary: MCML researchers contributed 9 papers to AAAI 2026 (6 main track, 3 workshops), covering topics like adversarial unlearning for multimodal LLMs, uncertainty quantification in ML, and whether LLMs think like the brain using fMRI evidence.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: MIO: Memories in Orbit and Blightstone Launch Today
items.summary: Two highly anticipated games, MIO: Memories in Orbit—a narrative-driven adventure—and Blightstone—a roguelike action RPG—released on January 20, 2026, for PC and consoles. These titles highlight indie storytelling and tactical gameplay in this week's lineup.

items.title: Loan Shark Psychological Horror Coming to PS5 Today
items.summary: Indie developer Studio Ortica and Dark Product announced Loan Shark, an atmospheric psychological horror game, launches on PlayStation 5 on January 20, 2026.

items.title: Gem Miner TD Launches on Steam Today
items.summary: iFeral Games' tower defense game Gem Miner TD officially launches on Steam on January 20, 2026, from the two-brother indie team.

items.title: Rainbow Six Siege Y10S4.2 Patch Releases Today
items.summary: Ubisoft released patch notes for Rainbow Six Siege Year 10 Season 4.2 on January 20, 2026, featuring buffs for operators Thorn, Mozzie, and Echo, plus numerous bug fixes.

items.title: Strategos Early Access Launches Today on PC
items.summary: Strategos, a real-time tactics strategy simulation game from MicroProse Software, enters early access on PC on January 20, 2026, focusing on large-scale battles.

items.title: Pocket Gamer Connects London 2026 Kicks Off
items.summary: Pocket Gamer Connects London 2026 began on January 19-20, 2026, featuring talks from Duolingo, Epic Games, and others, with expanded networking at The Brewery and Barbican Centre for 3,000 professionals.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
